intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron aethiopicum var. pubescens, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a species native to tropical Africa. It is a small to medium-sized tree characterized by its rough, fissured bark and deciduous leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody capsules containing small, dark seeds. It is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, often found in savannas and woodlands. The tree has been used traditionally for its latex, which has various applications in local communities.
